slide.title: EUS anatomy of portal venous system

slide.text: EUS anatomy of portal venous system Malay Sharma Director J.P hospital Noida Gastroenterology Unit Email: sharmamalay@hotmail.com

slide.title: PORTAL VENOUS SYSTEM
slide.text: PORTAL VENOUS SYSTEM Evaluation of Portal Venous System and its tributaries is important for preoperative assessment/ staging pancreatic malignancies/ and in portal venous pathologies. Rameshbabu CS, Wani ZA, Rai P, Abdulqader A, Garg S, Sharma M. Standard imaging techniques for assessment of portal venous system and its tributaries by linear endoscopic ultrasound: a pictorial essay. Endosc Ultrasound. 2013

slide.title: TIBUTARIES OF PORTAL VENOUS SYSTEM
slide.text:
MAJOR TRIBUTARIES FIRST ORDER TRIBUTARIES SECOND ORDER TRIBUTARIES PORTAL VEIN FORMATIVE TRIBUTARIES SPLENIC VEIN 1.SHORT GASTRIC 2. LEFT GASTROEPIPLOIC 3. PANCREATIC VEINS 4. INFERIOR MESENTERIC
4A. SUPERIOR RECTAL 4B- LEFT COLIC SUPERIOR MESENTERIC VEIN GASTROCOLIC TRUNK RIGHT COLIC 1ST JEJUNAL VEIN JEJUNAL ILEAL MIDDLE COLIC ILEOCOLIC MAIN TRUNK TRIBUTARIES LEFT GASTRIC RIGHT GASTRIC POSTERIOR SUPERIOR PANCREATICO-DUODENAL RIGHT BRANCH -PV CYSTIC VEIN LEFT BRANCH- PV PARAUMBILICAL TIBUTARIES OF PORTAL VENOUS SYSTEM

slide.title: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System
slide.titleNormalized: imaging of tributaries of portal venous system
slide.text: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System 1 place SV SMV PVC &PV Fundus never never Always The linear imaging of portal venous system can be done by rotation of the echo-endoscope at five places. SV- Splenic vein SMV-superior mesentric vein PV-portal vein PVC –Portal vein confluence

slide.title: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System
slide.titleNormalized: imaging of tributaries of portal venous system
slide.text: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System 2 place SV SMV PVC &PV Body always Always Mostly The linear imaging of portal venous system can be done by rotation of the echo-endoscope at five places. SV- Splenic vein SMV-superior mesentric vein PV-portal vein PVC –Portal vein confluence

slide.title: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System
slide.titleNormalized: imaging of tributaries of portal venous system
slide.text:
Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System 3 place SV SMV PVC &PV Antrum Never Mostly** Always
The linear imaging of portal venous system can be done by rotation of the echo-endoscope at five places. SV- Splenic vein SMV-superior mesentric vein PV-portal vein PVC –Portal vein confluence

slide.title: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System
slide.titleNormalized: imaging of tributaries of portal venous system
slide.text:
Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System 4 place SV SMV PVC &PV Bulb Sometimes Sometimes Always
PVC &PV The linear imaging of portal venous system can be done by rotation of the echo-endoscope at five places. SV- Splenic vein SMV-superior mesentric vein PV-portal vein PVC –Portal vein confluence

slide.title: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System
slide.titleNormalized: imaging of tributaries of portal venous system
slide.text: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System 5 place SV SMV PVC &PV Duodenum Sometimes Always Always The linear imaging of portal venous system can be done by rotation of the echo-endoscope at five places. SV- Splenic vein SMV-superior mesentric vein PV-portal vein PVC –Portal vein confluence

slide.title: All the three part of portal vein can be seen through bulb also
slide.titleNormalized: all the three part of portal vein can be seen through bulb also

slide.title: Portal vein through bulb
slide.text:
Portal vein through bulb
Infraduodenal part of portal vein forms a vascular seagull due to confluence of splenic vein and superior mesenteric vein.
Sharma M. et all, Seagulls of EUS. In press

slide.title: The splenic vein
slide.text: The splenic vein The splenic vein is best followed from body of stomach. It crosses left renal hilum above left renal vein. It runs below the splenic artery posterior to the tail of pancreas in front of Left Adrenal Gland.

slide.title: The Superior mesenteric vein (SMV)
slide.text: The Superior mesenteric vein (SMV) The SMV can be seen from stomach, duodenal bulb and descending duodenum (D2). This figure shows SMV from stomach

slide.title: SMV from bulb
slide.text: SMV from bulb

slide.title: SMV from D2
slide.text: SMV from D2

slide.title: Imaging of Tributaries, Where to look ?
slide.titleNormalized: imaging of tributaries, where to look ?
slide.text:
Imaging of Tributaries, Where to look ? SV is more or less horizontal vein . The SMV & PV are more or less vertical veins. Upper Lower Right Left The tributaries are generally seen to merge into right, left or upper, lower border of the veins.
Pancreatic tributaries do not enter the anterior surface of portal or superior mesenteric vein. White, 1973 Surgical anatomy of pancreas
Only PSPDV enters posterior surface Of portal vein

slide.title: The important tributaries of portal venous system
slide.titleNormalized: the important tributaries of portal venous system
slide.text:
The important tributaries of portal venous system Portal Vein Left gastric vein Posterior superior pancreticoduodenal vein.
Splenic Vein IMV
Superior mesenteric Vein Gastrocolic trunk First jejunal vein

slide.title: LEFT GASTRIC VEIN
slide.text: LEFT GASTRIC VEIN A B C A – Left gastric vein draining into Splenic vein. Douglass et al (1950) - 16.7 % Sakaguchi et al (2010) - 46.3 % Seong et al (2012) - 50.0 % B- Left gastric vein draining into splenoportal Confluence. Douglass et al (1950) - 58.9 % Sakaguchi et al (2010) - 14.7 % Seong et al (2012) - 14.0 % C – Left gastric vein draining into main Portal Vein. Douglass et al (1950) - 24.4 % Sakaguchi et al (2010) - 39.0 % Seong et al (2012) - 32.0 % * In 4 % cases abberant LGV was observed by Seong et al. (2012) draining directly into liver.

slide.title: LGV JOINING PVC
slide.text: LGV JOINING PVC Endosonographic image showing the joining of Left Gastric vein with Portal Vein Confluence.

slide.title: LGV joining portal vein
slide.text: LGV joining portal vein

slide.title: IMV
slide.text:
IMV Variations in the joining of inferior mesentric vein and left gastric vein can be picked up by EUS.
Douglass 1950

slide.title: Inferior mesenteric vein the facts
slide.text:
Inferior mesenteric vein the facts
A B A – Inferior Mesenteric Vein (IMV) joining Splenic vein (SV) Douglass et al (1950) - 38 % Kim et al (2007) – 53 % Sakaguchi et al (2010) - 68.5 % Papavasiliou et al (2012) - 54 % B – Inferior Mesenteric Vein joining Splenoportal Confluence Douglass et al (1950) - 32.7 % Kim et al (2007) – 12.0 % Sakaguchi et al (2010) - 7.6 % Papavasiliou et al (2012) - 17.0 %
Ramesh Babu CS, Sharma M., Biliary tract anatomy and its relationship with venous drainage. J Clin Exp Hepatol. 2014

slide.title: Inferior mesenteric vein the facts
slide.text:
C D C – Inferior Mesenteric Vein joining Superior Mesenteric Vein (SMV) Douglass et al (1950) - 29.3 % Kim et al (2007) – 31.0 % Sakaguchi et al (2010) - 18.5 % Papavasiliou et al (2012) - 27.0 %
D – Inferior Mesenteric Vein joining First Jejunal Vein Kim et al (2007) – 4.0 % Sakaguchi et al (2010) - 5.4 % Papavasiliou et al (2012) - 0.67 %
Biliary tract anatomy and its relationship with venous drainage. Ramesh Babu CS, Sharma M. J Clin Exp Hepatol. 2014 Inferior mesenteric vein the facts

slide.title: IMV may join SV
slide.text: IMV may join SV

slide.title: IMV joins junction
slide.text: IMV joins junction In 1/3rd cases the IMV Joins the junction of SMV with SV

slide.title: IMV plays an important role in evaluation of rectal varices
slide.titleNormalized: imv plays an important role in evaluation of rectal varices
slide.text: IMV plays an important role in evaluation of rectal varices 1Massive lower GI bleed from an endoscopically inevident rectal varices: diagnosis and management by EUS Sharma M, Somasundaram A.GIE. 2010 2 EUS-Assisted Evaluation of Rectal Varices before Banding.Sharma M, Rai P, Bansal R. Gastroenterol Res Pract. 2013;

slide.title: FIRST JEJUNAL VEIN
slide.text:
FIRST JEJUNAL VEIN A B A – First Jejunal Vein passing dorsal to SMA. Kim et al (2007) - 81 % Sakaguchi et al. (2010)- 87.18 % Papavasiliou et al (2012)- 59 %
B – First Jejunal Vein passing ventral to SMA. Kim et al (2007) - 19 % Sakaguchi et al. (2010)- 12.82 % Papavasiliou et al (2012)- 41.0 %

slide.title: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System summary
slide.titleNormalized: imaging of tributaries of portal venous system summary
slide.text: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System summary Many tributaries of portal venous system can be seen Following tributaries makes a detailed road map Tributaries may be important for the surgeons There may be a role in surgery of portal hyper tension and hepato biliary malignancy In early malignancy invasion of tributaries by tumor may change their flow characteristics The variations in joining of tributaries can be picked up by endosonography (IMV,& LGV)

slide.title: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System
slide.titleNormalized: imaging of tributaries of portal venous system
slide.text: Imaging of Tributaries of Portal Venous System Easily seen Seen with persistence Difficult to see Standard imaging techniques for assessment of portal venous system and its tributaries by linear endoscopic ultrasound: a pictorial essay. Rameshbabu CS, Wani ZA, Rai P, Abdulqader A, Garg S, Sharma M.Endosc Ultrasound. 2013
